skill.name: brand-guidelines
skill.description: Applies Anthropic's official brand colors and typography to any sort of artifact that may benefit from having Anthropic's look-and-feel. Use it when brand colors or style guidelines, visual formatting, or company design standards apply.
skill.summary: Applies Anthropic's official brand colors and typography to any sort of artifact that may benefit fr...
skill.author: DYAI2025

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only brand guidelines. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, and no external command execution. This is a safe reference guide for brand colors and typography.

content.user_title: Apply Anthropic Brand Colors and Typography
content.value_statement: Need consistent brand styling across your documents and artifacts. This skill provides official Anthropic brand guidelines including hex colors and typography specifications. Apply professional brand styling instantly.
actual_capabilities: Apply official Anthropic brand colors (Dark #141413, Light #faf9f5, accents)
Apply Poppins font to headings (24pt and larger)
Apply Lora font to body text with Georgia fallback
Apply accent colors (orange #d97757, blue #6a9bcc, green #788c5d) to shapes
Automatic font fallback to Arial and Georgia when custom fonts unavailable
limitations: Does not install fonts - requires pre-installed or system fonts
Does not modify existing files - provides guidelines only
No direct file output - for use with AI-assisted content creation
Does not validate brand compliance in external documents

use_cases.title: Create Branded Content
use_cases.description: Generate presentations, slides, and visual materials using Anthropic brand colors and typography

use_cases.title: Style Technical Docs
use_cases.description: Apply consistent brand styling to technical documentation and help files

use_cases.title: Design Marketing Materials
use_cases.description: Create on-brand marketing collateral with official color palettes and fonts

prompt_templates.title: Apply Brand Colors
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the brand-guidelines skill to apply Anthropic brand colors to this artifact. Use Dark #141413 for primary text and backgrounds. Use Light #faf9f5 for light backgrounds.

prompt_templates.title: Style Headings
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply Anthropic typography from brand-guidelines. Use Poppins font for all headings 24pt and larger. Fall back to Arial if Poppins is unavailable.

prompt_templates.title: Accent Colors
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the brand-guidelines skill for accent colors. Apply orange #d97757 as primary accent, blue #6a9bcc as secondary, and green #788c5d for tertiary elements.

prompt_templates.title: Complete Styling
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply the complete Anthropic brand styling using brand-guidelines. Include all main colors, accent colors, Poppins for headings, and Lora for body text with proper fallbacks.

output_examples.input: Apply Anthropic brand styling to a presentation about AI safety
output: Applied Dark #141413 as primary text color on light backgrounds
Applied Poppins font to all slide headings (24pt+)
Applied Lora font to body text with Georgia fallback
Used orange #d97757 accent for key highlights and callouts
Used blue #6a9bcc for secondary elements and diagrams

best_practices: Use Dark #141413 for text on light backgrounds and Light #faf9f5 for text on dark backgrounds
Apply Poppins to headings 24pt and larger for clear visual hierarchy
Use accent colors sparingly to maintain visual balance
anti_patterns: Using non-brand colors alongside official colors without clear distinction
Applying custom fonts without specifying fallbacks
Using accent colors as primary text colors instead of decorative elements

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. The skill provides brand guidelines that AI assistants can reference when generating content.

faq.question: Do I need to install fonts manually?
faq.answer: Poppins and Lora are recommended but not required. The skill provides automatic fallbacks to Arial and Georgia.

faq.question: Can I use these colors in commercial projects?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill provides brand guidelines for creating Anthropic-styled content. Check the license for commercial use terms.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my files directly?
faq.answer: No, this is a reference skill that provides guidelines. AI assistants use the information to style content they generate.

faq.question: What are the main brand colors?
faq.answer: Dark #141413, Light #faf9f5, Mid Gray #b0aea5, and Light Gray #e8e6dc. Accents are orange, blue, and green.

faq.question: How does this differ from other branding tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides Anthropic's official brand specifications directly. No configuration needed, just apply the documented colors and fonts.
